description: Smallest primitive prime factor of the n-th Lucas number (A000032); i.e. L(n), L(0) = 2, L(1) = 1 and L(n) = L(n-1) + L(n-2).
comments: A Lucas number can have more than one primitive factor; the primitive factors of L(22) are 43 and 307.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000 (using Blair Kelly's data)
mathematica: a=3; b=-1; prms={}; Table[c=a+b; a=b; b=c; f=First/@FactorInteger[c]; p=Complement[f, prms]; prms=Join[prms, p]; If[p=={}, 1, First[p]], {47}]
crossrefs: Cf. A086600 (number of primitive prime factors in L(n)).
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 16 2000
